name: Young River Dragon
senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 120 ft. (only detects vibrations in water), passive Perception 17

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Torrential Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales water in a 30-foot-long  5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw  taking 42 (12d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

special_abilities.name: Amphibious
special_abilities.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

special_abilities.name: Flowing Grace
special_abilities.desc: The dragon doesnt provoke opportunity attacks when it flies or swims out of an enemys reach.

special_abilities.name: Shimmering Scales
special_abilities.desc: While in water, the dragon gains three-quarters cover from attacks made by creatures more than 30 feet away.

special_abilities.name: Essence Link
special_abilities.desc: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

special_abilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
special_abilities.desc: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:create or destroy water, fog cloud
